enumeratedValue.name: UPPER_ONLY
enumeratedValue.description: Data is written to the upper half-word and the lower half-word is filled with 0's. An SCI interrupt is triggered when data is written, if enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: LOWER_ONLY
enumeratedValue.description: Data is written to the lower half-word, and the upper half-word is filled with 0's. An SCI interrupt is triggered when data is written, if enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: UPPER_FIRST
enumeratedValue.description: Two data words are packed into the register with the upper half-word representing the earlier data, and the lower half-word representing the later data. The ADC write to the lower half-word will trigger the SCI interrupt, if enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: LOWER_FIRST
enumeratedValue.description: Two data words are packed into the register with the lower half-word representing the earlier data, and the upper half-word representing the later data. The ADC write to the upper half-word will trigger the SCI interrupt, if enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable ADC scan mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable ADC scan mode. The ADC will scan through the defined time slots in sequence on every start of conversion.

enumeratedValue.name: ONCE
enumeratedValue.description: The channel sequencer will cycle through all of the specified time slots once.

enumeratedValue.name: LOOP
enumeratedValue.description: The channel sequencer will cycle through all of the specified time slots in a loop until SCANEN is cleared to 0.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the ADC module DMA interface.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the ADC module DMA interface.

enumeratedValue.name: LPOSC0
enumeratedValue.description: Burst mode uses the Low Power Oscillator.

enumeratedValue.name: APB
enumeratedValue.description: Burst mode uses the APB clock.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the ADC single data conversion complete interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the ADC single data conversion complete interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the ADC scan complete interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the ADC scan complete interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the data FIFO overrun interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the data FIFO overrun interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the data FIFO underrun interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the data FIFO underrun interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: INTERNAL
enumeratedValue.description: The internal device ground is used as the ground reference for ADC conversions.

enumeratedValue.name: EXTERNAL
enumeratedValue.description: The VREFGND pin is used as the ground reference for ADC conversions.

enumeratedValue.name: RISING
enumeratedValue.description: Select the rising edge of the APB clock.

enumeratedValue.name: FALLING
enumeratedValue.description: Select the falling edge of the APB clock.

enumeratedValue.name: ADCNT0
enumeratedValue.description: An ADC conversion triggers from the ADCnT0 ("On Demand" by writing 1 to ADBUSY) trigger source.

enumeratedValue.name: ADCNT1
enumeratedValue.description: An ADC conversion triggers from the ADCnT1 (Timer 0 Low Overflow) trigger source.

enumeratedValue.name: ADCNT2
enumeratedValue.description: An ADC conversion triggers from the ADCnT2 (Timer 0 High Overflow) trigger source.

enumeratedValue.name: ADCNT3
enumeratedValue.description: An ADC conversion triggers from the ADCnT3 (Timer 1 Low Overflow) trigger source.

enumeratedValue.name: ADCNT4
enumeratedValue.description: An ADC conversion triggers from the ADCnT4 (Timer 1 High Overflow) trigger source.

enumeratedValue.name: ADCNT5
enumeratedValue.description: An ADC conversion triggers from the ADCnT5 (EPCA0 synchronization pulse) trigger source.

enumeratedValue.name: ADCNT6
enumeratedValue.description: An ADC conversion triggers from the ADCnT6 (I2C0 Timer overflow) trigger source.

enumeratedValue.name: ADCNT7
enumeratedValue.description: An ADC conversion triggers from the ADCnT7 (RESERVED) trigger source.

enumeratedValue.name: ADCNT8
enumeratedValue.description: An ADC conversion triggers from the ADCnT8 (RESERVED) trigger source.

enumeratedValue.name: ADCNT9
enumeratedValue.description: An ADC conversion triggers from the ADCnT9 (RESERVED) trigger source.

enumeratedValue.name: ADCNT10
enumeratedValue.description: An ADC conversion triggers from the ADCnT10 (RESERVED) trigger source.

enumeratedValue.name: ADCNT11
enumeratedValue.description: An ADC conversion triggers from the ADCnT11 (RESERVED) trigger source.

enumeratedValue.name: ADCNT12
enumeratedValue.description: An ADC conversion triggers from the ADCnT12 (RESERVED) trigger source.

enumeratedValue.name: ADCNT13
enumeratedValue.description: An ADC conversion triggers from the ADCnT13 (RESERVED) trigger source.

enumeratedValue.name: ADCNT14
enumeratedValue.description: An ADC conversion triggers from the ADCnT14 (RESERVED) trigger source.

enumeratedValue.name: ADCNT15
enumeratedValue.description: An ADC conversion triggers from the ADCnT15 (ADCnT15 routed through crossbar) trigger source.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable burst mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable burst mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the ADC (low-power shutdown).

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the ADC (active and ready for data conversions).

enumeratedValue.name: FOUR
enumeratedValue.description: The ADC re-samples the input before each of the four conversions.

enumeratedValue.name: ONE
enumeratedValue.description: The ADC samples once before the first conversion and converts four times.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the common mode buffer.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the common mode buffer.

enumeratedValue.name: ACCUMULATE
enumeratedValue.description: Conversions will be accumulated for the specified number of cycles in burst mode according to the channel configuration.

enumeratedValue.name: REPEAT
enumeratedValue.description: Conversions will not be accumulated in burst mode.

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL
enumeratedValue.description: Normal Tracking Mode: When the ADC is enabled, a conversion begins immediately following the start-of-conversion signal.

enumeratedValue.name: DELAYED
enumeratedValue.description: Delayed Tracking Mode: When the ADC is enabled, a conversion begins 3 SAR clock cycles following the start-of-conversion signal. The ADC is allowed to track during this time.

enumeratedValue.name: MODE0
enumeratedValue.description: Select bias current mode 0. Recommended to use modes 1, 2, or 3.

enumeratedValue.name: MODE1
enumeratedValue.description: Select bias current mode 1 (SARCLK = 16 MHz).

enumeratedValue.name: MODE2
enumeratedValue.description: Select bias current mode 2.

enumeratedValue.name: MODE3
enumeratedValue.description: Select bias current mode 3 (SARCLK = 4 MHz).

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable low power mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable low power mode (requires extended tracking time).

field.name: MREFLPEN

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED

enumeratedValue.description: Select the VBAT pin as the ADC reference.

enumeratedValue.name: LDO_OUT

enumeratedValue.name: EXTERNAL_VREF

enumeratedValue.description: The on-chip PGA gain is 1.

enumeratedValue.description: The on-chip PGA gain is 0.5.

enumeratedValue.description: Accumulate one sample.

enumeratedValue.description: Accumulate four samples.

enumeratedValue.description: Accumulate thirty-two samples (10-bit mode only).

field.name: CHR2WCIEN
field.description: Conversion Characteristic 2 Window Comparator Interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable window comparison interrupts.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled window comparison interrupts. The window comparator will be used to check the ADC result on channels that use this characteristic.

enumeratedValue.name: B12
enumeratedValue.description: Select 12-bit Mode (burst mode must be enabled).

field.name: CHR0WCIEN
field.description: Conversion Characteristic 0 Window Comparator Interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable window comparison interrupts.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled window comparison interrupts. The window comparator will be used to check the ADC result on channels that use this characteristic.

enumeratedValue.name: UNITY
enumeratedValue.description: The on-chip PGA gain is 1.

enumeratedValue.name: HALF
enumeratedValue.description: The on-chip PGA gain is 0.5.

enumeratedValue.name: ACC1
enumeratedValue.description: Accumulate one sample.

enumeratedValue.name: ACC4
enumeratedValue.description: Accumulate four samples.

enumeratedValue.name: ACC8
enumeratedValue.description: Accumulate eight samples.

enumeratedValue.name: ACC16
enumeratedValue.description: Accumulate sixteen samples.

enumeratedValue.name: ACC32
enumeratedValue.description: Accumulate thirty-two samples (10-bit mode only).

enumeratedValue.name: ACC64
enumeratedValue.description: Accumulate sixty-four samples (10-bit mode only).

enumeratedValue.name: B10
enumeratedValue.description: Select 10-bit Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: B12
enumeratedValue.description: Select 12-bit Mode (burst mode must be enabled).

field.name: CHR1WCIEN
field.description: Conversion Characteristic 1 Window Comparator Interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable window comparison interrupts.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled window comparison interrupts. The window comparator will be used to check the ADC result on channels that use this characteristic.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A window compare interrupt has not occurred. Write: Clear the interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A window compare interrupt occurred. Write: Force a window compare interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A single data conversion interrupt has not occurred. Write: Clear the interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A single data conversion interrupt occurred. Write: Force a single data conversion interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A scan done interrupt has not occurred. Write: Clear the interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A scan done interrupt occurred. Write: Force a scan done interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A data FIFO overrun interrupt has not occurred. Write: Clear the interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A data FIFO overrun interrupt occurred. Write: Force a data FIFO overrun interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A data FIFO underrun interrupt has not occurred. Write: Clear the interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A data FIFO underrun interrupt occurred. Write: Force a data FIFO underrun interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: LOWER
enumeratedValue.description: The next ADC conversion will be written to the lower half-word.

enumeratedValue.name: UPPER
enumeratedValue.description: The next ADC conversion will be written to the upper half-word.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: New data is not produced yet.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: New data is ready.

field.name: RFRQI
field.description: Receive FIFO Read Request Interrupt Flag.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: The RX FIFO has fewer bytes than the level defined by RFTH.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: The RX FIFO has equal or more bytes than the level defined by RFTH.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A receive FIFO overrun has not occurred. Write: Clear the flag.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A receive FIFO overrun occurred. Write: Force a receive overrun interrupt.

field.name: TFRQI
field.description: Transmit FIFO Write Request Interrupt Flag.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: The TX FIFO has fewer empty slots than the level defined by TFTH.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: The TX FIFO has at least as many empty slots as the level defined by TFTH.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A transmit FIFO overrun has not occurred. Write: Clear the flag.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A transmit FIFO overrun occurred. Write: Force a transmit overrun interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: The slave select signal (NSS) is not active.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: The slave select signal (NSS) is active.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A master mode collision is not detected. Write: Clear the flag.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A master mode collision occurred. Write: Force a mode fault interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A data transfer is still in progress. Write: Clear the flag.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: The transmit FIFO and shift register are empty and the data transfer has ended. Write: Force an underrun interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: There is data still present in the transmit FIFO or shift register.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: All data has been transferred out of the shift register and there is no data waiting in the transmit FIFO.

field.name: RFILI
field.description: Illegal Receive FIFO Access Interrupt Flag.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: An illegal write or read of the receive FIFO has not occurred. Write: Clear the flag.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: An illegal write or read of the receive FIFO occurred. Write: Force an illegal receive access interrupt.

field.name: TFILI
field.description: Illegal Transmit FIFO Access Interrupt Flag.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: An illegal write or read of the transmit FIFO has not occurred. Write: Clear the flag.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: An illegal write or read of the transmit FIFO occurred. Write: Force an illegal transmit access interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: NSS is currently a logic low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: NSS is currently a logic high.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: The SPI is not busy and a transfer is not in progress.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: The SPI is currently busy and a transfer is in progress.

enumeratedValue.description: The SPI module will continue to operate while the core is halted in debug mode.

enumeratedValue.name: HALT
enumeratedValue.description: A debug breakpoint will cause the SPI module to halt.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disregard CTS byte.

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic. The request type determines the number of bytes to write/read.

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSFER1
enumeratedValue.description: A single byte is written/read per request.

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSFER2
enumeratedValue.description: Up to two bytes can be written/read per request.

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSFER3
enumeratedValue.description: Up to three bytes can be written/read per request.

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSFER4

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the faster DMA mode. The DMA module and channels will behave like a standard uDMA.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the faster DMA mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable debugging through Power Mode 8.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable debugging through Power Mode 8. Power measurements cannot be made with debugging enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: APB
enumeratedValue.description: Select the APB clock as the timer source.

enumeratedValue.name: EXTOSCN
enumeratedValue.description: Select the external oscillator clock as the timer source. The external oscillator must run slower than one-half the APB clock.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMER_CLKDIV
enumeratedValue.description: Select the dedicated 8-bit prescaler as the timer source.

enumeratedValue.name: CT_FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Select falling edges of the CT signal as the timer clock source.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: MSTRUN does not need to be set for the low timer to run.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: MSTRUN must be set for the low timer to run.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The timer operates as a single 32-bit timer controlled by the high timer fields.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The timer operates as two independent 16-bit timers.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The state of the LEXI flag does not affect the low timer interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: A low timer interrupt request is generated if LEXI is set to 1.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The state of LOVFI does not affect the low timer interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: A low timer interrupt request is generated if LOVFI = 1.

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO_RELOAD
enumeratedValue.description: The low timer is in Auto-Reload Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: UP_DOWN
enumeratedValue.description: The low timer is in Up/Down Count Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: FALL_CAPTURE
enumeratedValue.description: The low timer is in Falling Edge Capture Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: RISE_CAPTURE
enumeratedValue.description: The low timer is in Rising Edge Capture Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW_CAPTURE
enumeratedValue.description: The low timer is in Low Time Capture Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH_CAPTURE
enumeratedValue.description: The low timer is in High Time Capture Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DC_CAPTURE
enumeratedValue.description: The low timer is in Duty Cycle Capture Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ONESHOT
enumeratedValue.description: The low timer is in Oneshot Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: STOP
enumeratedValue.description: Stop the low timer if split mode is enabled (SPLITEN = 1).

enumeratedValue.name: START
enumeratedValue.description: The low timer runs if split mode is enabled (SPLITEN = 1) and (LMSTREN = 0 or MSTRUN = 1 in Timer 0).

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A low timer extra interrupt is not pending. Write: Clear the interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: Indicates the low 16-bit timer has been captured, reloaded with all 1's when counting down, or the timer matched the capture register in PWM mode. This interrupt flag can be set by hardware in all modes except Auto-Reload and Toggle. This flag is not set by hardware when split mode is disabled (SPLITEN = 0). Write: Force a low timer extra interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A low timer overflow interrupt is not pending. Write: Clear the interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: The low 16-bit timer has wrapped or reloaded after reaching all 1's. This bit is set by the module regardless of the state of SPLITEN and can be set in all modes. Write: Force a low timer overflow interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: APB
enumeratedValue.description: Select the APB clock as the timer source.

enumeratedValue.name: EXTOSCN
enumeratedValue.description: Select the external oscillator clock as the timer source. The external oscillator must run slower than one-half the APB clock.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMER_CLKDIV
enumeratedValue.description: Select the dedicated 8-bit prescaler as the timer source.

enumeratedValue.name: CT_FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Select falling edges of the CT signal as the timer clock source.

enumeratedValue.name: STOP
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the master run control for all timers.

enumeratedValue.name: START
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the master run control for all timers.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: MSTRUN does not need to be set for the timer to run.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: MSTRUN must be set for the timer to run.

enumeratedValue.name: RUN
enumeratedValue.description: The timer will continue to operate while the core is halted in debug mode.

enumeratedValue.name: HALT
enumeratedValue.description: A debug breakpoint will cause the Timer to halt.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The state of the HEXI flag does not affect the high timer interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: A high timer interrupt request is generated if HEXI is set to 1.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The state of HOVFI does not affect the high timer interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: A high timer interrupt request is generated if HOVFI is set to 1.

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO_RELOAD
enumeratedValue.description: The high 16-bit timer or entire 32-bit timer is in Auto-Reload Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: UP_DOWN
enumeratedValue.description: The high 16-bit timer or entire 32-bit timer is in Up/Down Count Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: FALL_CAPTURE
enumeratedValue.description: The high 16-bit timer or entire 32-bit timer is in Falling Edge Capture Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: RISE_CAPTURE
enumeratedValue.description: The high 16-bit timer or entire 32-bit timer is in Rising Edge Capture Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW_CAPTURE
enumeratedValue.description: The high 16-bit timer or entire 32-bit timer is in Low Time Capture Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH_CAPTURE
enumeratedValue.description: The high 16-bit timer or entire 32-bit timer is in High Time Capture Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DC_CAPTURE
enumeratedValue.description: The high 16-bit timer or entire 32-bit timer is in Duty Cycle Capture Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ONESHOT
enumeratedValue.description: The high 16-bit timer or entire 32-bit timer is in Oneshot Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: TOGGLE
enumeratedValue.description: The high 16-bit timer or entire 32-bit timer is in Square Wave Output Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: PWM
enumeratedValue.description: The high 16-bit timer or entire 32-bit timer is in PWM Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: STOP
enumeratedValue.description: Stop the high timer or entire 32-bit timer.

enumeratedValue.name: START
enumeratedValue.description: The high timer runs if HMSTREN = 0 or MSTRUN (in Timer 0) = 1. The full 32-bit timer runs if split mode is disabled and (HMSTREN = 0 or MSTRUN = 1).

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A high timer extra interrupt is not pending. Write: Clear the interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: Indicates the high 16-bit timer (or 32-bit timer if SPLITEN = 0) has been captured, reloaded with all 1's when counting down, or the timer matched the capture register in PWM mode. This interrupt flag can be set by the timer module in all modes except Auto-Reload and Toggle. Write: Force a high timer extra interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A high timer overflow interrupt is not pending. Write: Clear the interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: If split mode is enabled (SPLITEN = 1), this value indicates the high 16-bit timer has wrapped or reloaded after reaching all 1's. If split mode is disabled (SPLITEN = 0), this value indicates the 32-bit timer has wrapped or reloaded after reaching all 1's. The timer module can set this bit in all modes. Write: Force a high timer overflow interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: APB
enumeratedValue.description: Select the APB clock as the timer source.

enumeratedValue.name: EXTOSCN
enumeratedValue.description: Select the external oscillator clock as the timer source. The external oscillator must run slower than one-half the APB clock.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMER_CLKDIV
enumeratedValue.description: Select the dedicated 8-bit prescaler as the timer source.

enumeratedValue.name: CT_FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Select falling edges of the CT signal as the timer clock source.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: MSTRUN does not need to be set for the low timer to run.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: MSTRUN must be set for the low timer to run.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The timer operates as a single 32-bit timer controlled by the high timer fields.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The timer operates as two independent 16-bit timers.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The state of the LEXI flag does not affect the low timer interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: A low timer interrupt request is generated if LEXI is set to 1.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The state of LOVFI does not affect the low timer interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: A low timer interrupt request is generated if LOVFI = 1.

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO_RELOAD
enumeratedValue.description: The low timer is in Auto-Reload Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: UP_DOWN
enumeratedValue.description: The low timer is in Up/Down Count Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: FALL_CAPTURE
enumeratedValue.description: The low timer is in Falling Edge Capture Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: RISE_CAPTURE
enumeratedValue.description: The low timer is in Rising Edge Capture Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW_CAPTURE
enumeratedValue.description: The low timer is in Low Time Capture Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH_CAPTURE
enumeratedValue.description: The low timer is in High Time Capture Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DC_CAPTURE
enumeratedValue.description: The low timer is in Duty Cycle Capture Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ONESHOT
enumeratedValue.description: The low timer is in Oneshot Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: STOP
enumeratedValue.description: Stop the low timer if split mode is enabled (SPLITEN = 1).

enumeratedValue.name: START
enumeratedValue.description: The low timer runs if split mode is enabled (SPLITEN = 1) and (LMSTREN = 0 or MSTRUN = 1 in Timer 0).

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A low timer extra interrupt is not pending. Write: Clear the interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: Indicates the low 16-bit timer has been captured, reloaded with all 1's when counting down, or the timer matched the capture register in PWM mode. This interrupt flag can be set by hardware in all modes except Auto-Reload and Toggle. This flag is not set by hardware when split mode is disabled (SPLITEN = 0). Write: Force a low timer extra interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A low timer overflow interrupt is not pending. Write: Clear the interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: The low 16-bit timer has wrapped or reloaded after reaching all 1's. This bit is set by the module regardless of the state of SPLITEN and can be set in all modes. Write: Force a low timer overflow interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Do not expect a start bit during receptions.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Expect a start bit during receptions.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Do not expect a parity bit during receptions.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Expect a parity bit during receptions.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Do not expect stop bits during receptions.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Expect stop bits during receptions.

enumeratedValue.name: 0P5_STOP
enumeratedValue.description: 0.5 stop bit.

enumeratedValue.name: 1_STOP
enumeratedValue.description: 1 stop bit.

enumeratedValue.name: 1P5_STOP
enumeratedValue.description: 1.5 stop bits.

enumeratedValue.name: 2_STOP
enumeratedValue.description: 2 stop bits.

enumeratedValue.name: ODD
enumeratedValue.description: Odd Parity.

enumeratedValue.name: EVEN
enumeratedValue.description: Even Parity.

enumeratedValue.name: MARK
enumeratedValue.description: Set (Parity = 1).

enumeratedValue.name: SPACE
enumeratedValue.description: Clear (Parity = 0).

enumeratedValue.name: 5_BITS
enumeratedValue.description: 5 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: 6_BITS
enumeratedValue.description: 6 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: 7_BITS
enumeratedValue.description: 7 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: 8_BITS
enumeratedValue.description: 8 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: 9_BITS_STORED
enumeratedValue.description: 9 bits. The 9th bit is stored in the FIFO (normal mode).

enumeratedValue.name: 9_BITS_MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: 9 bits. The 9th bit is not stored in the FIFO (fixed mode). This mode is used when the 9th bit is only used for match operations (see MATMD).

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The receiver does not send a Smartcard parity error response.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The receiver sends a Smartcard parity response.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The receiver does not operate in IrDA mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The receiver operates in IrDA mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Do not invert the RX pin signals (the RX idle state is high).

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Invert the RX pin signals (the RX idle state is low).

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Do not generate a start bit during transmissions.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Generate a start bit during transmissions.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Do not send a parity bit during transmissions.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Send a parity bit during transmissions.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Do not send stop bits during transmissions.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Send stop bits during transmissions.

enumeratedValue.name: 0P5_STOP
enumeratedValue.description: 0.5 stop bit.

enumeratedValue.name: 1_STOP
enumeratedValue.description: 1 stop bit.

enumeratedValue.name: 1P5_STOP
enumeratedValue.description: 1.5 stop bits.

enumeratedValue.name: 2_STOP
enumeratedValue.description: 2 stop bits.

enumeratedValue.name: ODD
enumeratedValue.description: Odd Parity.

enumeratedValue.name: EVEN
enumeratedValue.description: Even Parity.

enumeratedValue.name: MARK
enumeratedValue.description: Set (Parity = 1).

enumeratedValue.name: SPACE
enumeratedValue.description: Clear (Parity = 0).

enumeratedValue.name: 5_BITS
enumeratedValue.description: 5 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: 6_BITS
enumeratedValue.description: 6 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: 7_BITS
enumeratedValue.description: 7 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: 8_BITS
enumeratedValue.description: 8 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: 9_BITS_FIFO
enumeratedValue.description: 9 bits. The 9th bit is taken from the FIFO data (normal mode).

enumeratedValue.name: 9_BITS_TBIT
enumeratedValue.description: 9 bits. The 9th bit is set by the value of TBIT (fixed mode).

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The transmitter does not check for a Smartcard parity error response.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The transmitter checks for a Smartcard parity error response.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable IrDA transmit mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable IrDA transmit mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Do not invert the TX pin signals (the TX idle state is high).

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Invert the TX pin signals (the TX idle state is low).

enumeratedValue.name: APBCLK
enumeratedValue.description: UART clocked from the APB clock. The RBAUD and TBAUD controls will use the APB clock mode to determine the baudrate unless RTCBDMD = 1.

enumeratedValue.name: RTC0TCLK
enumeratedValue.description: UART clocked from RTC0TCLK. The RBAUD and TBAUD controls will use the RTC0TCLK mode to determine the baudrate. Software should only set this bit to one when the UART is idle.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The RBAUD and TBAUD controls use the RTCCKMD setting to determine whether to use APB clock mode (RTCCKMD = 0) or the RTC0TCLK mode (RTCCKMD = 1). Use this setting when APB clock != RTC0TCLK.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The RBAUD and TBAUD controls use RTC0TCLK mode. Use this setting when APB clock = RTC0TCLK and RTCCKMD = 0 to force the RBAUD and TBAUD controls into RTC0TCLK mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: UART clock is only on when necessary.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Force the UART clock to always be on.

enumeratedValue.name: IDLE
enumeratedValue.description: Clock switch completed.

enumeratedValue.name: BUSY
enumeratedValue.description: Clock switch in progress.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: UART will always use the selected clock for receive operations.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: UART will automatically switch from RTC0TCLK to the APB clock when a receive interrupt is pending.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: UART will always use the selected clock for transmit operations.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: UART will automatically switch from RTC0TCLK to the APB clock when a transmit interrupt is pending.

enumeratedValue.name: RUN
enumeratedValue.description: The UART module will continue to operate while the core is halted in debug mode.

enumeratedValue.name: HALT
enumeratedValue.description: A debug breakpoint will cause the UART module to halt. Any active transmissions and receptions will complete first.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Loop back is disabled and the TX and RX signals are connected to the corresponding external pins.

enumeratedValue.name: RXONLY
enumeratedValue.description: Receive loop back. The receiver input path is disconnected from the RX pin and internally connected to the transmitter. Data transmitted will be sent out on TX and also received by the device.

enumeratedValue.name: TXONLY
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit loop back. The transmitter output path is disconnected from the TX pin and the RX input pin is internally looped back out to the TX pin. Data received at RX will be received by the device and also sent directly back out on TX.

enumeratedValue.name: BOTH
enumeratedValue.description: Full loop back. Internally, the transmitter output is routed back to the receiver input. Neither the transmitter nor receiver are connected to external device pins. The device pin RX is looped back to TX in a similar fashion. Data transmitted on TX will be sent directly back in on RX.

enumeratedValue.name: FULL_DUPLEX
enumeratedValue.description: Full-duplex mode. The transmitter and receiver can operate simultaneously.

enumeratedValue.name: HALF_DUPLEX
enumeratedValue.description: Half-duplex mode. The transmitter automatically inhibits when the receiver is active and the receiver automatically inhibits when the transmitter is active.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The TX pin is always an output in this mode, even when idle.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The TX pin is tristated when idle.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: RX pin (after optional inversion) is low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: RX pin (after optional inversion) is high.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The pin assigned to TX is controlled by the direct port output value.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The pin assigned to TX is controlled by the UART.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: The TX pin (before optional inversion) is low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: The TX pin (before optional inversion) is high.

enumeratedValue.name: 1_16TH
enumeratedValue.description: The IrDA pulse width is 1/16th of a bit period.

enumeratedValue.name: 1_8TH
enumeratedValue.description: The IrDA pulse width is 1/8th of a bit period.

enumeratedValue.name: 3_16TH
enumeratedValue.description: The IrDA pulse width is 3/16th of a bit period.

enumeratedValue.name: 1_4TH
enumeratedValue.description: The IrDA pulse width is 1/4th of a bit period.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A frame error has not occurred since RFRMERI was last cleared. Write: Clear the interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A frame error occurred. Write: Force a frame error interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: An invalid parity bit has not been received since RPARERI was last cleared. Write: Clear the interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: An invalid parity bit has been received since RPARERI was last cleared. Write: Force a parity error interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A receiver overrun has not occurred since ROREI was last cleared. Write: Clear the interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A receiver overrun occurred. Write: Force a receiver overrun interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Fewer than RFTH FIFO entries are filled with data.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: At least RFTH FIFO entries are filled with data.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the receive error interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the receive error interrupt. A receive interrupt is asserted when ROREI, RFRMERI, or RPARERI is set to 1.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the read data request interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the read data request interrupt. A receive interrupt is generated when RDREQI is set to 1.

enumeratedValue.name: OFF
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the match function.

enumeratedValue.name: MCE
enumeratedValue.description: (MCE) Data whose last data bit equals RBIT is accepted and stored.

enumeratedValue.name: FRAME
enumeratedValue.description: (Frame) A framing error is asserted if the last received data bit matches RBIT.

enumeratedValue.name: STORE
enumeratedValue.description: (Store) Store the last incoming data bit in RBIT. This mode can be used inconjunction with the RDATLN setting.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable receiver auto-baud.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable receiver auto-baud.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: The UART receiver is idle.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: The UART receiver is receiving data.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable one-shot receive mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable one-shot receive mode.

enumeratedValue.name: INACTIVE
enumeratedValue.description: The receiver operates normally.

enumeratedValue.name: ACTIVE
enumeratedValue.description: The receiver will complete any ongoing reception, but ignore all traffic after that.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the receiver. The receiver can receive one data transaction only if ROSEN is set.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the receiver.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A Smartcard parity error has not occurred since TSCERI was last cleared. Write: Clear the interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A Smartcard parity error occurred. Write: Force a Smartcard parity error interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: The transmitter is not requesting more FIFO data.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: The transmitter is requesting more FIFO data.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A transmit has not completed since TCPTI was last cleared. Write: Clear the interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A byte was transmitted (TCCPTH = 0) or the last available byte was transmitted (TCPTTH = 1). Write: Force a transmit complete interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_ON_TX
enumeratedValue.description: The TCPTI flag is set after each data transmission.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_ON_EMPTY
enumeratedValue.description: The TCPTI flag is set after transmission of the last available data.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the transmit error interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the transmit error interrupt. A transmit interrupt is generated when TUREI or TSCERI is set to 1.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the transmit data request interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the transmit data request interrupt. A transmit interrupt is asserted when TDREQI is set to 1.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the transmit complete interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the transmit complete interrupt. A transmit interrupt is generated when TCPTI is set to 1.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: The UART transmitter is idle.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: The UART transmitter is active and transmitting.

enumeratedValue.name: INACTIVE
enumeratedValue.description: The transmitter operates normally.

enumeratedValue.name: ACTIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Transmissions are inhibited. The transmitter will stall after any current transmission is complete.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the transmitter. When cleared, the transmitter immediately aborts any active transmission. Clearing this bit does not automatically flush the transmit FIFO.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the transmitter. The transmitter will initiate a transmission when data becomes available in the transmit FIFO.

enumeratedValue.name: ONE
enumeratedValue.description: A read data request interrupt (RDREQI) is asserted when >= 1 FIFO entry is full.

enumeratedValue.name: TWO
enumeratedValue.description: A read data request interrupt (RDREQI) is asserted when >= 2 FIFO entries are full.

enumeratedValue.name: THREE
enumeratedValue.description: A read data request interrupt (RDREQI) is asserted when >= 3 FIFO entries are full.

enumeratedValue.name: FOUR
enumeratedValue.description: A read data request interrupt (RDREQI) is asserted when >= 4 FIFO entries are full.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Flush the contents of the receive FIFO and any data in the receive shift register.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: A receive FIFO error has not occurred since RFERI was last cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: A receive FIFO error occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: The receive data shift register is not full.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: The receive data shift register is full.

enumeratedValue.name: ONE
enumeratedValue.description: A transmit data request interrupt (TDREQI) is asserted when >= 1 FIFO entry is empty.

enumeratedValue.name: TWO
enumeratedValue.description: A transmit data request interrupt (TDREQI) is asserted when >= 2 FIFO entries are empty.

enumeratedValue.name: THREE
enumeratedValue.description: A transmit data request interrupt (TDREQI) is asserted when >= 3 FIFO entries are empty.

enumeratedValue.name: FOUR
enumeratedValue.description: A transmit data request interrupt (TDREQI) is asserted when >= 4 FIFO entries are empty.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Flush the contents of the transmit FIFO. If data is pending in the transmit shift register but a transmit has not begun, the shift register is also flushed.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: A transmit FIFO error has not occurred since TFERI was last cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: A transmit FIFO error occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: The transmit shift register is not full.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: The transmit shift register is full.

enumeratedValue.name: DIV1
enumeratedValue.description: Divide by 1.

enumeratedValue.name: DIV2
enumeratedValue.description: Divide by 2.

enumeratedValue.name: DIV4
enumeratedValue.description: Divide by 4.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Do not expect a start bit during receptions.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Expect a start bit during receptions.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Do not expect a parity bit during receptions.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Expect a parity bit during receptions.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Do not expect stop bits during receptions.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Expect stop bits during receptions.

enumeratedValue.name: 0P5_STOP
enumeratedValue.description: 0.5 stop bit.

enumeratedValue.name: 1_STOP
enumeratedValue.description: 1 stop bit.

enumeratedValue.name: 1P5_STOP
enumeratedValue.description: 1.5 stop bits.

enumeratedValue.name: 2_STOP
enumeratedValue.description: 2 stop bits.

enumeratedValue.name: ODD
enumeratedValue.description: Odd Parity.

enumeratedValue.name: EVEN
enumeratedValue.description: Even Parity.

enumeratedValue.name: MARK
enumeratedValue.description: Set (Parity = 1).

enumeratedValue.name: SPACE
enumeratedValue.description: Clear (Parity = 0).

enumeratedValue.name: 5_BITS
enumeratedValue.description: 5 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: 6_BITS
enumeratedValue.description: 6 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: 7_BITS
enumeratedValue.description: 7 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: 8_BITS
enumeratedValue.description: 8 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: 9_BITS_STORED
enumeratedValue.description: 9 bits. The 9th bit is stored in the FIFO (normal mode).

enumeratedValue.name: 9_BITS_MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: 9 bits. The 9th bit is not stored in the FIFO (fixed mode). This mode is used when the 9th bit is only used for match operations (see MATMD).

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The receiver does not send a Smartcard parity error response.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The receiver sends a Smartcard parity response.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The receiver does not operate in IrDA mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The receiver operates in IrDA mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Do not invert the RX pin signals (the RX idle state is high).

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Invert the RX pin signals (the RX idle state is low).

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The receiver operates in asynchronous mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The receiver operates in synchronous mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Do not generate a start bit during transmissions.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Generate a start bit during transmissions.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Do not send a parity bit during transmissions.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Send a parity bit during transmissions.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Do not send stop bits during transmissions.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Send stop bits during transmissions.

enumeratedValue.name: 0P5_STOP
enumeratedValue.description: 0.5 stop bit.

enumeratedValue.name: 1_STOP
enumeratedValue.description: 1 stop bit.

enumeratedValue.name: 1P5_STOP
enumeratedValue.description: 1.5 stop bits.

enumeratedValue.name: 2_STOP
enumeratedValue.description: 2 stop bits.

enumeratedValue.name: ODD
enumeratedValue.description: Odd Parity.

enumeratedValue.name: EVEN
enumeratedValue.description: Even Parity.

enumeratedValue.name: MARK
enumeratedValue.description: Set (Parity = 1).

enumeratedValue.name: SPACE
enumeratedValue.description: Clear (Parity = 0).

enumeratedValue.name: 5_BITS
enumeratedValue.description: 5 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: 6_BITS
enumeratedValue.description: 6 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: 7_BITS
enumeratedValue.description: 7 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: 8_BITS
enumeratedValue.description: 8 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: 9_BITS_FIFO
enumeratedValue.description: 9 bits. The 9th bit is taken from the FIFO data (normal mode).

enumeratedValue.name: 9_BITS_TBIT
enumeratedValue.description: 9 bits. The 9th bit is set by the value of TBIT (fixed mode).

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The transmitter does not check for a Smartcard parity error response.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The transmitter checks for a Smartcard parity error response.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable IrDA transmit mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable IrDA transmit mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Do not invert the TX pin signals (the TX idle state is high).

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Invert the TX pin signals (the TX idle state is low).

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The transmitter operates in asynchronous mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The transmitter operates in synchronous mode.

enumeratedValue.name: RUN
enumeratedValue.description: The USART module will continue to operate while the core is halted in debug mode.

enumeratedValue.name: HALT
enumeratedValue.description: A debug breakpoint will cause the USART module to halt. Any active transmissions and receptions will complete first.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Loop back is disabled and the TX and RX signals are connected to the corresponding external pins.

enumeratedValue.name: RXONLY
enumeratedValue.description: Receive loop back. The receiver input path is disconnected from the RX pin and internally connected to the transmitter. Data transmitted will be sent out on TX and also received by the device.

enumeratedValue.name: TXONLY
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit loop back. The transmitter output path is disconnected from the TX pin and the RX input pin is internally looped back out to the TX pin. Data received at RX will be received by the device and also sent directly back out on TX.

enumeratedValue.name: BOTH
enumeratedValue.description: Full loop back. Internally, the transmitter output is routed back to the receiver input. Neither the transmitter nor receiver are connected to external device pins. The device pin RX is looped back to TX in a similar fashion. Data transmitted on TX will be sent directly back in on RX.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: When the USART is a clock master, the clock is not generated during stop bits.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: When the USART is a clock master, the clock is generated during stop bits.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: When the USART is a clock master, the clock is held idle during a start bit.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: When the USART is a clock master, the clock is generated during a start bit.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: When the USART is a clock master, the clock is held idle between transmissions.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: When the USART is a clock master, the clock is generated between transmissions or receptions.

enumeratedValue.name: FULL_DUPLEX
enumeratedValue.description: Full-duplex mode. The transmitter and receiver can operate simultaneously.

enumeratedValue.name: HALF_DUPLEX
enumeratedValue.description: Half-duplex mode. The transmitter automatically inhibits when the receiver is active and the receiver automatically inhibits when the transmitter is active.

enumeratedValue.name: IDLE_LOW
enumeratedValue.description: The synchronous clock is low when idle.

enumeratedValue.name: IDLE_HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: The synchronous clock is high when idle.

enumeratedValue.name: FALLING
enumeratedValue.description: The clock falls in the middle of each bit.

enumeratedValue.name: RISING
enumeratedValue.description: The clock rises in the middle of each bit.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The TX and UCLK (if in synchronous master mode) pins are always an output in this mode, even when idle.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: If ISTCLK is cleared to 0, the TX pin is tristated when idle. The UCLK pin will also be tristated when idle if in synchronous master mode.

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE
enumeratedValue.description: The USART operates as a slave.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER
enumeratedValue.description: The USART operates as a master.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: RTS pin (before optional inversion) is driven low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: RTS pin (before optional inversion) is driven high.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: RX pin (after optional inversion) is low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: RX pin (after optional inversion) is high.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The USART does not invert the RTS signal before driving the pin.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The USART inverts the RTS signal driving the pin.

enumeratedValue.name: FULL
enumeratedValue.description: RTS is de-asserted when the receive FIFO and shift register are full and no more incoming data can be stored.

enumeratedValue.name: ONE_BYTE_FREE
enumeratedValue.description: RTS is de-asserted when the receive FIFO and shift register are nearly full and only one more data can be received.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The RTS state is not changed by hardware. The RTS bit can be written only when hardware RTS is disabled (RTSEN = 0).

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware sets RTS when the receive FIFO is at or above the threshold set by RTSTH and clears RTS otherwise.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The pin assigned to TX is tri-stated, regardless of other settings.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The pin assigned to TX is controlled by the USART.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Indicates the CTS pin state (after optional inversion) is low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: Indicates the CTS pin state (after optional inversion) is high.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: The TX pin (before optional inversion) is low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: The TX pin (before optional inversion) is high.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: The UCLK pin is low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: The UCLK pin is high.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The USART does not invert CTS.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The USART inverts CTS.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The CTS pin state does not affect transmissions.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Transmissions will begin only if the CTS pin (after optional inversion) is low.

enumeratedValue.name: 1_16TH
enumeratedValue.description: The IrDA pulse width is 1/16th of a bit period.

enumeratedValue.name: 1_8TH
enumeratedValue.description: The IrDA pulse width is 1/8th of a bit period.

enumeratedValue.name: 3_16TH
enumeratedValue.description: The IrDA pulse width is 3/16th of a bit period.

enumeratedValue.name: 1_4TH
enumeratedValue.description: The IrDA pulse width is 1/4th of a bit period.

enumeratedValue.description: Read: A frame error has not occurred since RFRMERI was last cleared. Write: Clear the interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: A frame error occurred. Write: Force a frame error interrupt.

enumeratedValue.description: Disable the transmit complete interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the transmit complete interrupt. A transmit interrupt is generated when TCPTI is set to 1.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: The USART transmitter is idle.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: The USART transmitter is active and transmitting.

enumeratedValue.name: INACTIVE
enumeratedValue.description: The transmitter operates normally.

enumeratedValue.name: ACTIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Transmissions are inhibited. The transmitter will stall after any current transmission is complete.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the transmitter. When cleared, the transmitter immediately aborts any active transmission. Clearing this bit does not automatically flush the transmit FIFO.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the transmitter. The transmitter will initiate a transmission when data becomes available in the transmit FIFO.

enumeratedValue.name: ONE
enumeratedValue.description: A DMA request or read data request interrupt (RDREQI) is asserted when >= 1 FIFO entry is full.

enumeratedValue.name: TWO
enumeratedValue.description: A DMA request or read data request interrupt (RDREQI) is asserted when >= 2 FIFO entries are full.

enumeratedValue.name: THREE
enumeratedValue.description: A DMA request or read data request interrupt (RDREQI) is asserted when >= 3 FIFO entries are full.

enumeratedValue.name: FOUR
enumeratedValue.description: A DMA request or read data request interrupt (RDREQI) is asserted when >= 4 FIFO entries are full.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable receive FIFO DMA requests.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable receive FIFO DMA requests.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Flush the contents of the receive FIFO and any data in the receive shift register.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: A receive FIFO error has not occurred since RFERI was last cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: A receive FIFO error occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: The receive data shift register is not full.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: The receive data shift register is full.

enumeratedValue.name: ONE
enumeratedValue.description: A DMA request or transmit data request interrupt (TDREQI) is asserted when >= 1 FIFO entry is empty.

enumeratedValue.name: TWO
enumeratedValue.description: A DMA request or transmit data request interrupt (TDREQI) is asserted when >= 2 FIFO entries are empty.

enumeratedValue.name: THREE
enumeratedValue.description: A DMA request or transmit data request interrupt (TDREQI) is asserted when >= 3 FIFO entries are empty.

enumeratedValue.name: FOUR
enumeratedValue.description: A DMA request or transmit data request interrupt (TDREQI) is asserted when >= 4 FIFO entries are empty.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable transmit FIFO DMA requests.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable transmit FIFO DMA requests.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Flush the contents of the transmit FIFO. If data is pending in the transmit shift register but a transmit has not begun, the shift register is also flushed.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: A transmit FIFO error has not occurred since TFERI was last cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: A transmit FIFO error occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: The transmit shift register is not full.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: The transmit shift register is full.

enumeratedValue.name: VBAT_IS_BELOW_RESET
enumeratedValue.description: The VBAT voltage is below the VBAT reset threshold.

enumeratedValue.name: VBAT_IS_ABOVE_RESET
enumeratedValue.description: The VBAT voltage is above the VBAT reset threshold.

enumeratedValue.name: VBAT_IS_LOW
enumeratedValue.description: The VBAT voltage is below the early warning threshold.

enumeratedValue.name: VBAT_IS_OK
enumeratedValue.description: The VBAT voltage is above the early warning threshold.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Use the standard VBAT thresholds.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Use the high VBAT thresholds.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the VBAT low interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the VBAT low interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the VBAT supply monitor.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the VBAT supply monitor.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: VREF output is nominally 1.2 V

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: VREF output is nominally 2.4 V

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the temperature sensor.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the temperature sensor.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Internal VREF is not driven on the VREF pin.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Internal VREF is driven out to the VREF pin.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the early warning interrupt (EWI).

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the early warning interrupt (EWI).

enumeratedValue.name: RUN
enumeratedValue.description: The WDTIMER module will continue to operate while the core is halted in debug mode.

enumeratedValue.name: HALT
enumeratedValue.description: A debug breakpoint will cause the WDTIMER module to halt.

enumeratedValue.name: IDLE
enumeratedValue.description: No keys have been processed by the interface.

enumeratedValue.name: READY
enumeratedValue.description: The attention key has been received and the module is awaiting a command.

enumeratedValue.name: READ_ONLY
enumeratedValue.description: The watchdog timer registers are currently read-only.

enumeratedValue.name: READ_WRITE
enumeratedValue.description: A write transaction can be performed on the module registers.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: An early warning match did not occur. Write: Clear the early warning interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Read: An early warning match occurred and the interrupt is pending. Write: Force a watchdog timer early warning interrupt to occur.

enumeratedValue.name: LT
enumeratedValue.description: The counter is currently less than the reset threshold (RTH) value.

enumeratedValue.name: GTE
enumeratedValue.description: The counter is currently greater than or equal to the reset threshold (RTH) value.

enumeratedValue.name: IDLE
enumeratedValue.description: An update completed or is not pending. The EWTH and RTH fields can be written.

enumeratedValue.name: UPDATING
enumeratedValue.description: An update of the threshold register is occurring. The EWTH and RTH fields should not be modified until hardware clears UPDSTS to 0.

enumeratedValue.name: ATTN
enumeratedValue.description: Attention key to start the command sequence.

enumeratedValue.name: RESET
enumeratedValue.description: Reset the watchdog timer.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the watchdog timer.

enumeratedValue.name: START
enumeratedValue.description: Start the watchdog timer.

enumeratedValue.name: WRITE
enumeratedValue.description: Allow one write access to the module registers.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCK
enumeratedValue.description: Lock the module from any other writes until the next system reset.
